title: Now Putin Is Claiming Russian Inflation Will Be Transitory
sub_head: This guy is starting to sound a little desperate.
body:
Yesterday this column noted the economic and financial pain that Vladimir Putin is inflicting on his fellow Russians and wondered how long they would tolerate it. Looks like Mr. Putin has been wondering the same thing. Even though he’s worked hard to ensure he won’t have to face free elections, Russia’s chief thug nevertheless sees a political need to announce new policies to mitigate the harm caused by his invasion of Ukraine.
Mr. Putin surely didn’t want to admit the high cost of his decision to turn his country into an international pariah. But he’s clearly decided that the topic can’t be avoided even in official communication. The Journal’s Alexander Osipovich reports:
